page.title: 12FARMING.COLSTON BULL FARM.
page.content: {Colston House}is owned by{Mr.Taylor.} It is of{37 hectares.}There are{48 {bulls,}some are quite rare. The Bull Farm is in aid of keeping bull's for their{sperm.}They{freeze}the sperm in {liquid nitrogen}at{minus 200oC.}The old system was to keep one bull if the farmer wanted to breed more cows. Now the Bull Farm does it for them. They send the sperm out in packages to the farmers who need it. The{6 labourers} work a{ten hour day. Colston House}is very famous and exports its sperm all over the world. There are{eleven}types of Bull:{Fresian, Blonde D'aguatane, {Belgium Blues, Heriford, Charolais, {Limousin, Jersey, Aberdeen Angus, {Ayrshire, Morray Grey, Holstiens.}The{ {Holstiens}that{Mr. Taylor} owns are from{Germany}and{Canada. Mr. Taylor} plans to extend the number and breeds of Bulls on his farm in the future.
